Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Daytona Speedway area”
Reviews.Author: RacingMom
Reviews.Content: This had to have been a regular Holiday Inn at one time, the rooms all have balcony's and are extra big. They have a huge swimming pool and tennis courts! I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming in for a sporting event or just wanting to check out the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would not come back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: quexi
Reviews.Content: Traveling from NC to FL we decided to stay in Daytona. We have had a good experience with the Hiliday Inn Express in SC, GA and FL.The hotel is conveniently located close to I-95, reasonable priced, but did not seem to be the cleanest. The room smelled humid and the bathroom eventhough looked clean, had a poor look and very small. I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: bayless12
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable room. Drink machine wasn't working, (yeah.. one machine according to staff) had to leave the premises to get a coke!

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cukagomdz
Reviews.Content: We had a good time in this hotel. The only bummer was that they gave us a king bed and the four of us had to sleep in the same bed, but we were sooo tired that it didn't matter. It has a good view and I thought the continental breakfast was included, but it was not.... Overall good price for what you get, but the location is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: AskCalvin
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn is a fantastic value. We stay at the Ocean Walk for a week every year. My group and I always get anxious and decide to leave early. We picked the Holiday Inn for it's cheap price ($59) but we were pleasantly suprised. Very large rooms, clean and in good shape. The property is definitely older, but it's very nice. A wonderful hot breakfast is included in the price which makes it all that much more of a value. An olympic size swimming pool is another great feature of the property. You can't go wrong for a short stay at this place! Also don't miss Miller's Ale House behind the property for a great dinner. We recommend the Buffalo Chiken strips (Zingers I think?). Man they were good! Mention that you are staying at the HI and you'll get 10% off the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel worked for : location, amenities, and overall comfort”
Reviews.Author: FloridaScamp
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler this hotel worked: great location, reasonable price, quiet. Older property that has had some renovations to front lobby area. Found the room clean, safe, and worked well for one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “I Should Have Listened”
Reviews.Author: TSW28214
Reviews.Content: I was given a heads up that there were bugs in the rooms but I went against what I was hearing. The hotel is not bad, it's old but not bad. My family and I checked the mattresses as closely as possible but, we didn't see any bedbugs. However, there were bugs all over the desk! I mean everywhere. Not sure whether they were termites or what but I took a video of them crawling around. I ended up having to go to Wal-Mart at 2:30 in the morning to get bug spray. Well needless to say, I called the front desk to complain and guess what no answer after 3 tries. I walk to the front desk and no clerk to be found. And there are other guests calling as well. Peek out the front since the doors were wide open and what do you know she's around the corner in a little nook smoking a cigarette. And when I told Debbie the night clerk what the issue was there was no empathy whatsoever. All she said was well what kind of bugs are they. Lady I don't know I am not an exterminator! She then attempts to give me another room which smelled like a mildew dungeon. I ended up staying in the room and using my spray. I hope I didn't bring any of those suckers home with me. I have stayed in the Holiday Inn Express before and I will tell you this is no Holiday Inn Express. If I were the IHG or whatever management company, I would not allow them to use my name. I will never stay at this motel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable Hotel in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly large clean and comfortable. The room had an older fridge but no microwave. I checked in at midnight and the clerk gave me a rate twenty two dollars less than AAA. The room had a balcony over looking the pool. The breakfast was very good with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl9611
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times always loved it. The hotel and rooms are clean and the service is very personable. Huge pool, my kids loved it. Breakfast is fresh.

Reviews.Title: “I saw a bed bug!”
Reviews.Author: lila108
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during bike week and saw a bed bug on the mattress! I know what they look like and it was 100% a bed bug! Yikes! I found the hotel dirty with ants in the bathroom and room, will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Nordictat2
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel as far as location...we stayed there for bike week. There was a bit of confustion when we checked in because we booked a friends a family rate and every other time I have used this...payment was taken within a few days of booking however the man at the desk said it wasn't paid for!?!?! Now onto the room...we seemed to be put in the back of the hotel which was a good walk from the main entrance. The room itself was fine BUT after the 2nd night bith my husband and myself woke up with little bite marks. Now i let this go because I surely thought it was a fluke of some kind but this continued and by the time check out came I had atleast 5 small bite marks on my leg. I told this to the woman who checked me out and she seemed to care less and just said she would have someone look into it... Needless to say we will not be staying at this hotel again..even if it is close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't expensive and close to a lot of places. Mins from the speedway.”
Reviews.Author: VelmaBuckman
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the place. It wasnt far from the beach and close to just about everything. It had a friendly staff and a nice simple breakfest. We would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not during a race week”
Reviews.Author: justjoank
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn is very close to the Speedway, but during the 24 hour, you can hear the cars loud and clear. If that is music to your ears, you are in great shape, if not, stay further away. The breakfast bar was nice and hot and fresh though and it has a beautiful pool. So if you are traveling outside of race dates, you should have a nice stay. Also, the hotel is right next to the Daytona Alehouse with lots of TVs and good bar food and you don't have to take your car!

Reviews.Title: “spring break”
Reviews.Author: mamadix
Reviews.Content: I was changed from this hotel to another hotel because i did not purchase a time share. This was a clean and comfortable hotel. Because of my stay here i only go to holiday in expresses now. The breakfast was very nice. Our kids enjoyed the pool. it is hard to find, however that was ok. We were here for my daughter's cheerleading competition. The hotel is not where all the traffic is, so we came back to the area to eat and spend time with her before they left.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and old, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Arnt78
Reviews.Content: This is clearly a older property which have been poorly renovated. Our room was dirty, the carpets filthy and the bathroom floor and tub full of someones hair. The only thing that seemed clean was the linen. We got the room late at night after looking for a while, and that is the only reason why we did not leave. Old fixtures, worn furniture and noisy fridge, noisy and not very effective AC unit. The breakfast was ok, but understocked. WILL NOT GO BACK.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: joe k
Reviews.Content: we came down for bikeoberfest friendly staff , clean motel, served full breakfast buffet with room (eggs pancakes biscuit gravy hot and cold cereal...etc) central location WE WILL BE BACK IN SPRING

Reviews.Title: “A great respite for road weary travelers”
Reviews.Author: divegaldeb
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel on out way to the Keys. It is right off of the interstate. We were traveling with a lot of sports gear so it took 2 carts to get it in the room. Our room was supposed to be a non-smoking room but when we opened the door, it reeked of cigarettes. Out room was at the far end of the building so I left my husband with the carts and went to the front desk. Mary and Krystal were very apologetic and worked with me to find another room. They found a handicap room right beside the parking lot for vehicles pulling trailers. We were pulling our boat so this was ideal. Then, because it was 3 buildings away, Krystal pushed one of the carts for us. This was her last night because she was transferring to a new location, and yet she went out of her way to help us and so did Mary. Thank you ladies for going the extra mile!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed after a Long Day”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily34116
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found ourselves in need of a hotel late one night after an extremely long day of driving and helping family move. We chose this Holiday Inn Express location when we couldn't drive any longer and the sign was shining brightly from the highway! As late as it was the lobby was bright and welcoming and the front desk staff was courteous. We were happy to be given a room with the biggest king sized bed we had ever seen and a spacious bathroom. Everything was very clean and the shower felt like a dream come true after a really long day. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast the next morning and the pool area was really set apart as a nice retreat from a very busy, downtown type location. We would certainly stay here again if we found ourselves in this area. It seems to be a great place to stay if you were going to be a spectator at any of the Daytona races.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with very long hallways and deep swimmimg pool”
Reviews.Author: penguinlimo
Reviews.Content: I was only here for about 12 hours so I can say only what I saw. Upon Check in I noticed the lobby looked nice and I could tell it is an older property from maybe the 60's or 70's. There is an open staircase in the lobby to the second floor. Room was a nice king room and hotel is all NON SMOKING and NO PETS Per sign seen in lobby. The hallways are very long and only one elevator for the whole building. Folks with lots of luggage, make sure you have wheels on your bags. Nice LG flat panel TV set in room and very user friendly. Sadly no microwave in room, just a fridge in my room. Bathroom was decent and bed was a little stiff for me. I took a walk around the hotel and liked the pool for having a deep side to it. 13 feet deep. Very rare. Pool is large and has water jets at the edge of the pool that shoot water into pool which will be great on a hot day. Time did not allow for me to enjoy it. Breakfast was decent and I like the pancake machine. Press OK and you get 2 pancakes, walla. Exercise room has alot to offer including free weights and alot of other equipment. To get there when coming off I 95. Go east of 95 and be on your left lane and turn left on Indigo Dr where you will see a large sigh or a shopping center with Marshalls sign and Holiday Inn Express on that big sign. then take your very first left again and hotel will be past the Daytona Ale House on the right. Your GPS cannot decipher it very well, FYI. It is Across the street from the Daytona International Speedway next to the on ramp for 95 north.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick overnight at the Holiday Inn Express. It is a bit hard to find because it is located in a shopping center. The hotel is very old! My room was on the second floor facing the pool. It was very average, the pillows on the bed said "soft" and "firm" but there was absolutely no difference between the pillows. The balcony was dirty. The windows looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a long time. The room did have a flat-screen TV though. The beds were okay but I did notice ants on the night stand. The Pool was a bit dirty and while we were swimming there were a few dead roaches and insects floating in it. The breakfast was okay, I have stayed at other HIE's and they have been much better. Overall, the hotel is fine but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS”
Reviews.Author: PULAOKHAO
Reviews.Content: Paid $89+tax on business rate. I checked in around 7 pm and left at 6 am so did not use any amenities like pool. There is only one free computer with internet connection and printer near front desk. Breakfast does not start till 6:30 am so was after I left and hence cannot comment. But front desk was friendly and told me I could help myself to whatever food was already out there by 6 am. Since priority club member, got a free bottle of water and a packet of crackers at check in. Bed and cable TV were normal; I think rooms still have old CRT TV and not new LCD flat screens. Hotel is right off I-95 exit for International Speedway. Close to airport and Daytona-500 course. Lots of restaurants and shops near by; commercial area. But room was quiet and not disturbed by freeway or other noise. Window ventilation unit noise was not excessive. My room had microwave, small fridge and coffee machine

Reviews.Title: “No frills - ok for short stay”
Reviews.Author: norman2
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic hotel for a couple nights, this will fit the bill. Nothing fancy but the rate was good. Complimentary wireless internet access was a plus. The beds could use some additional padding but it was comfortable enough to get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: ShariPensacola
Reviews.Content: Eight of us from a ladies tennis team stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Check in was easy. Room change request was handled quickly. Rooms were simple but clean. Breakfast was more than adequate in that there were bisquits, gravy, bacon, eggs, cereal, bagels, etc. and the staff kept it well stocked. The location for us was excellent in that it is near I95, the Florida Tennis Center and an abundance of shops/restaurants. The tennis courts at the hotel are in need of repair. Atleast 50% of the lights were out and nets straps, etc needed repair. I was very disappointed at check out when the clerk spent the entire process on the phone with a family member discussing her sick daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, near the Daytona Speedway.”
Reviews.Author: BigDiverChris
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel for the price. I paid $71 plus tax. It was clean and the beds were reasonably confortable. We had a microwave and refrigerator in our room and a patio. The Internet connection worked fine. They have a huge olympic-size pool, though we did not swim in it because we didn't have enough time. They provided free breakfast which was good, including eggs, sausage, bacon, hot cinnamon rolls, biscuits and gravy, cereals, milk, and juices. The only negative thing that I can think of was that there was loud, heavy-bass music coming from outside until midnight. Sometimes I could hear it over my TV with the door closed. I think it was the bar across the way. It didn't really bother me much, but I could understand how it might bother others especially those who go to be early or who are light sleepers. Across the main road is Ker's Wing House. It is similar to Hooters, but they have really good food. When I went they had a deal with the hotel for 10% off your entire bill if you show your room key.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CallawayGirl
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and staff is great. Breakfast is very good. Close to everything without being right in the middle of the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “A return to a Holiday Inn of the past, but still clean and nice.”
Reviews.Author: usmcsgtftl
Reviews.Content: First, let me say this is definitely not what Holiday Inn markets as a HI Express. This is an older property, definitely a Holiday Inn that has been rebadged, and while that may be the case, it's still a place I can recommend. The rooms, while somewhat dated, are clean. The beds sleep quite comfortably, and there's a huge cable channel selection. Compimentary wireless internet service is provided. I was astounded to find no less than five wireless connections available, all for the hotel. Had the hotel not had a pop-up that would show up at random while I was surfing, I would have said this hotel's internet service was the best I have ever encountered. As well, this hotel features an enormous pool; it's no wonder another TripAdvisor member complained they felt the pool was cold, as the pool is significantly larger than what one would find at a newer property. The deep end truly is deep--thirteen feet, in fact. It is attractively landscaped and appeared very clean. There is a complimentary breakfast buffet provided in the mornings that is amply stocked with a selection of juices, cinnamon rolls, eggs, cereals, and two meats. There were also biscuits and gravy served; it is a must to serve the gravy on the biscuits to help soften them. I was immediately reminded of the "fighting muffins" from the first Charlie's Angels film, and that's not an exaggeration. The hotel staff was extremely polite and courteous. The facility itself, while dated, is clean and presentable. I would definitely recommend this property to families traveling with children, but there is one small warning to pass: the doors on this property do not have any sort of spring-loaded arm to ensure a slow, quiet closure. Instead, every door I encountered swung closed rapidly. I could see a small child getting their hand or arm caught if they were not paying attention. Just keep an eye on the doors, and the little ones will do just fine at this property.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel convenient to the interstate”
Reviews.Author: huskertravelers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this recently remodeled Holiday Inn Express. The hotel and rooms were clean and modest. The hot breakfast was very nicely laid out with hot and cold selections. The pool is very large and well kept. We were just passing through after staying at Blue Springs Park and found this to be a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KYM123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was hard to find. Kind of hidden. The exterior of the hotel doesn't look so nice, but the rooms do get better. And their pool is large and beautiful! My family is not high maintenance, but we also don't want to be sleeping next to roaches; so for this hotel, our overall stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay by the speedway”
Reviews.Author: Spark_Jewel
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Daytona recently. This is very close to the speedway (as the address might indicate) with shopping and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel is a bit older hotel that has been renovated but is clean, spacious and bright. The rooms still have balcony or sliding glass walk-outs. The hotel has a large pool, kid's wading pool and tennis courts. The Express Breakfast met my expectations for the Holiday Inn Express. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Our only complaint was that the highspeed internet connection was set up at the bedside table instead of at the desk or other table so we had to use our laprtop on the floor. All in all, this is a perfectly reasonable hotel in the Daytona area, within a 15-minute drive to Daytona Beach, close to the speedway and I-95. I would stay here again. *note: the room did not have a microwave as most Holiday Inn Express do now. It did have a mini fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mrfuni
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, right off I-75. Good for stop over, but a ride to the beaches. Ale House Restaurant next door which was convenient after a long day of riding. Clean room, cold air, balcony, and lots of channels on the TV. Decent breakfast, big pool, I would recommend this property if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach location shame about the decor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location to the beach but in reality it didn't live up to what you expect from holiday express. The Hotel needed a face lift it was bland and tired and the pool was colder than the sea!

Reviews.Title: “This place blows”
Reviews.Author: bannakin
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is no Holiday Inn Express. Rather, it seems to be an old, rundown, ancient Holiday Inn that they decided put Express on the end of...I guess to lure unsuspecting travelers. Anyway...stained carpets, lights that don't work, poor color on the TV, uncomfortable bed, terrible looking shower (probably not dirty, just looks to be) were just a few things i noticed upon entering the room. To make my point even stronger...I am NOT picky when it comes to hotels. Just give me a clean room and a comfy bed and you won't hear a peep. But this place....this place SUCKS. Not to mention it was $290/night...granted, it is Rolex 24hrs of Daytona weekend, but $290?!?!?!? Move the decimal point one spot and I think you have a more realistic price for this HOLE.

Reviews.Title: “Dropping off college student”
Reviews.Author: jluczak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property when we were taking our son to college in the Daytona Beach area. We we arrived in Daytona, we needed a hotel that provided a sofa sleeper, as we had two adults, and two teenagers, one girl, one boy. Not only did we have a sofa sleeper, but it was located in a small seperate room with a second TV and another small sofa. Lots of room, very comfortable. Our daughter even continued to sleep on the sleeper sofa, after one of the double beds was freed up. The desk staff were very friendly, and always spoke when we passed by. The morning breakfast was very nice. As was the pool. We didn't get to spend much time there, but we plan to stay at this hotel when we visit our son at school. Would definitely recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We drove to Florida from New York and arrived the evening before we could check into our condo unit in Orlando. Decided to stop for dinner and find a room. The Holiday Inn Express is located close to I-95 and just down the road from where we stopped for dinner. The only available room was a smoking room so we agreed (its only for one night, right?). Unfortunately for us, as nonsmokers, the smell in the room was really gross. We tolerated it for the night and won't ever again. The complimentary continental breakfast was more than expected. There was plenty of food and much to choose from. The eating area was clean and nice. We didn't get a chance to check out the grounds so I cannot comment on that. I would not discourage anyone from staying here. Its not the closest to the beach if you want a beach vacation and if you're a nonsmoker, don't get a smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service sells this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. During a week-long "tour" of Florida, my husband and I stayed here for two days. Out of the four hotels we stayed in, this was our favorite. The continental breakfast was more than we have seen offered in other hotels. The accommodations are clean and spacious. If you're a NASCAR fan, this hotel is conveniently located near the Daytona Speedway. It is also only a short drive to the beach. Most importantly, the staff was very professional and kind. The smiling front desk attendants were a welcome sight after a long drive. Also, check out the Ale House next door. Excellent food for reasonable prices...save room for dessert. The ice cream cake is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Not your ordinary Express Property”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Even though it is right at I-95 and International Speedway Blvd., the property looks like an old time Florida Resort. There's a huge pool and six lighted tennis courts. You can walk to the Speedway from here. They serve the standard continental breakfast but every Wednesday (weather permitting), they have a poolside cookout. The general manager cooks up a mean cheeseburger. They have hot dogs, chips and soft drinks. Best of all, it's free.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Daytona I-95 & W. Speedway Blv
HotelInfo.Address: 2620 W International Speedway Boulevard, Daytona Beach, FL 32114
